problems.title: Reverse an Array
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given an array of N integers. Your task is to reverse the array and print the elements.

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N (size of the array).
The second line contains N space-separated integers.

Output Format
Print the reversed array elements separated by spaces.

Example
Input: 5
1 2 3 4 5
Output: 5 4 3 2 1
problems.constraints:
1 ≤ N ≤ 10^5
-10^9 ≤ Array elements ≤ 10^9
Time Complexity: O(N)
Space Complexity: O(1)

starterCodes.code:
def reverseArray(arr, n):
    # TODO: Reverse the array in-place or return a reversed list
    return arr

def solve():
    import sys
    input_data = sys.stdin.read().split()
    if not input_data: return
    n = int(input_data[0])
    arr = list(map(int, input_data[1:]))
    result = reverseArray(arr, n)
    print(*(result))

if __name__ == '__main__':
    solve()

hintsList: Use two pointers, one at the start and one at the end, and swap elements until they meet.

problems.title: Find Frequency of an Element
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given an array of N integers and a target element X. Your task is to find how many times X appears in the array.

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N (size of the array).
The second line contains N space-separated integers.
The third line contains the target integer X.

Output Format
Print the frequency of X in the array.

Example
Input:
5
1 2 2 3 2
2
Output: 3
problems.constraints:
1 ≤ N ≤ 10^5
-10^9 ≤ Array elements, X ≤ 10^9
Time Complexity: O(N)
Space Complexity: O(1)

starterCodes.code:
def findFrequency(arr, n, x):
    # TODO: Return the frequency of x in arr
    return 0

def solve():
    import sys
    input_data = sys.stdin.read().split()
    if not input_data: return
    n = int(input_data[0])
    arr = list(map(int, input_data[1:n+1]))
    x = int(input_data[n+1])
    print(findFrequency(arr, n, x))

if __name__ == '__main__':
    solve()

hintsList: Iterate through the array and increment a counter whenever you find an element equal to X.

problems.title: Remove Duplicates from Sorted Array
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given a sorted array of N integers. Your task is to remove the duplicate elements in-place such that each unique element appears only once. Return the new length of the array and print the unique elements.

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N (size of the array).
The second line contains N space-separated sorted integers.

Output Format
Print the unique elements separated by spaces.

Example
Input: 6
1 1 2 2 3 3
Output: 1 2 3
problems.constraints:
1 ≤ N ≤ 10^5
-10^9 ≤ Array elements ≤ 10^9
Array is sorted
Time Complexity: O(N)
Space Complexity: O(1)

starterCodes.code:
def removeDuplicates(arr, n):
    # TODO: Remove duplicates in-place and return the new length
    return n

def solve():
    import sys
    input_data = sys.stdin.read().split()
    if not input_data: return
    n = int(input_data[0])
    arr = list(map(int, input_data[1:]))
    new_len = removeDuplicates(arr, n)
    print(*(arr[:new_len]))

if __name__ == '__main__':
    solve()

hintsList: Use two pointers: one to track the current unique element and another to iterate through the array.

problems.title: Find Maximum and Minimum
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given an array of N integers. Your task is to find the maximum and minimum elements in the array.

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N (size of the array).
The second line contains N space-separated integers.

Output Format
Print the maximum and minimum elements separated by a space.

Example
Input: 5
10 20 4 45 99
Output: 99 4
problems.constraints:
1 ≤ N ≤ 10^5
-10^9 ≤ Array elements ≤ 10^9
Time Complexity: O(N)
Space Complexity: O(1)
hintsList: Initialize max and min with the first element of the array and update them as you iterate through the rest of the array.

problems.title: Rearrange Even and Odd Elements
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given an array of N integers. Your task is to rearrange the array such that all even numbers appear first, followed by all odd numbers. You must maintain the relative order of the even numbers and the relative order of the odd numbers (Stable Partition).

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N (size of the array).
The second line contains N space-separated integers.

Output Format
Print the rearranged array elements separated by spaces.

Example
Input: 5
1 2 3 4 5
Output: 2 4 1 3 5
problems.constraints:
1 ≤ N ≤ 10^5
-10^9 ≤ Array elements ≤ 10^9
Time Complexity: O(N)
Space Complexity: O(1) or O(N)

starterCodes.code:
def rearrangeEvenOdd(arr, n):
    # TODO: Rearrange array so evens come first
    return arr

def solve():
    import sys
    input_data = sys.stdin.read().split()
    if not input_data: return
    n = int(input_data[0])
    arr = list(map(int, input_data[1:]))
    result = rearrangeEvenOdd(arr, n)
    print(*(result))

if __name__ == '__main__':
    solve()

hintsList: You can use two pointers (left and right) to swap even and odd elements, or create a new array and fill it with evens then odds.
